00001 /**
00002  * \file Geodesic.cpp
00003  * \brief Implementation for GeographicLib::Geodesic class
00004  *
00005  * Copyright (c) Charles Karney (2009, 2010) <charles@karney.com>
00006  * and licensed under the LGPL.  For more information, see
00007  * http://geographiclib.sourceforge.net/
00008  *
00009  * This is a reformulation of the geodesic problem.  The notation is as
00010  * follows:
00011  * - at a general point (no suffix or 1 or 2 as suffix)
00012  *   - phi = latitude
00013  *   - beta = latitude on auxiliary sphere
00014  *   - omega = longitude on auxiliary sphere
00015  *   - lambda = longitude
00016  *   - alpha = azimuth of great circle
00017  *   - sigma = arc length along greate circle
00018  *   - s = distance
00019  *   - tau = scaled distance (= sigma at multiples of pi/2)
00020  * - at northwards equator crossing
00021  *   - beta = phi = 0
00022  *   - omega = lambda = 0
00023  *   - alpha = alpha0
00024  *   - sigma = s = 0
00025  * - a 12 suffix means a difference, e.g., s12 = s2 - s1.
00026  * - s and c prefixes mean sin and cos
00027  **********************************************************************/
00028 
00029 #include "GeographicLib/Geodesic.hpp"
00030 #include "GeographicLib/GeodesicLine.hpp"
00031 
00032 #define GEOGRAPHICLIB_GEODESIC_CPP "$Id: Geodesic.cpp 6864 2010-09-10 03:20:41Z karney $"
00033 
00034 RCSID_DECL(GEOGRAPHICLIB_GEODESIC_CPP)
00035 RCSID_DECL(GEOGRAPHICLIB_GEODESIC_HPP)

00039   using namespace std;

00041   // Underflow guard.  We require
00042   //   eps2 * epsilon() > 0
00043   //   eps2 + epsilon() == epsilon()
00044   const Math::real Geodesic::eps2 = sqrt(numeric_limits<real>::min());
00045   const Math::real Geodesic::tol0 = numeric_limits<real>::epsilon();
00046   const Math::real Geodesic::tol1 = 100 * tol0;
00047   const Math::real Geodesic::tol2 = sqrt(numeric_limits<real>::epsilon());
00048   const Math::real Geodesic::xthresh = 1000 * tol2;
00049 
00050   Geodesic::Geodesic(real a, real r)
00051     : _a(a)
00052     , _r(r)
00053     , _f(_r != 0 ? 1 / _r : 0)
00054     , _f1(1 - _f)
00055     , _e2(_f * (2 - _f))
00056     , _ep2(_e2 / sq(_f1))       // e2 / (1 - e2)
00057     , _n(_f / ( 2 - _f))
00058     , _b(_a * _f1)
00059     , _c2((sq(_a) + sq(_b) *
00060            (_e2 == 0 ? 1 :
00061             (_e2 > 0 ? Math::atanh(sqrt(_e2)) : atan(sqrt(-_e2))) /
00062             sqrt(abs(_e2))))/2) // authalic radius squared
00063     , _etol2(tol2 / max(real(0.1), sqrt(abs(_e2))))
00064   {
00065     if (!(_a > 0))
00066       throw GeographicErr("Major radius is not positive");
00067     if (!(_f < 1))
00068       throw GeographicErr("Minor radius is not positive");
00069     A3coeff();
00070     C3coeff();
00071     C4coeff();
00072   }

00074   const Geodesic Geodesic::WGS84(Constants::WGS84_a(), Constants::WGS84_r());
00075 
00076   Math::real Geodesic::SinCosSeries(bool sinp,
00077                                     real sinx, real cosx,
00078                                     const real c[], int n) throw() {
00079     // Evaluate
00080     // y = sinp ? sum(c[i] * sin( 2*i    * x), i, 1, n) :
00081     //            sum(c[i] * cos((2*i+1) * x), i, 0, n-1) :
00082     // using Clenshaw summation.  N.B. c[0] is unused for sin series
00083     // Approx operation count = (n + 5) mult and (2 * n + 2) add
00084     c += (n + sinp);            // Point to one beyond last element
00085     real
00086       ar = 2 * (cosx - sinx) * (cosx + sinx), // 2 * cos(2 * x)
00087       y0 = n & 1 ? *--c : 0, y1 = 0;          // accumulators for sum
00088     // Now n is even
00089     n /= 2;
00090     while (n--) {
00091       // Unroll loop x 2, so accumulators return to their original role
00092       y1 = ar * y0 - y1 + *--c;
00093       y0 = ar * y1 - y0 + *--c;
00094     }
00095     return sinp
00096       ? 2 * sinx * cosx * y0    // sin(2 * x) * y0
00097       : cosx * (y0 - y1);       // cos(x) * (y0 - y1)
00098   }

00100   GeodesicLine Geodesic::Line(real lat1, real lon1, real azi1, unsigned caps)
00101     const throw() {
00102     return GeodesicLine(*this, lat1, lon1, azi1, caps);
00103   }

00106                                  bool arcmode, real s12_a12, unsigned outmask,
00107                                  real& lat2, real& lon2, real& azi2,
00108                                  real& s12, real& m12, real& M12, real& M21,
00109                                  real& S12) const throw() {
00110     return
00111       GeodesicLine(*this, lat1, lon1, azi1,
00112                    // Automatically supply DISTANCE_IN if necessary
00113                    outmask | (arcmode ? NONE : DISTANCE_IN))
00114       .                         // Note the dot!
00115       GenPosition(arcmode, s12_a12, outmask,

00119   Math::real Geodesic::GenInverse(real lat1, real lon1, real lat2, real lon2,
00120                                   unsigned outmask,
00121                                   real& s12, real& azi1, real& azi2,
00122                                   real& m12, real& M12, real& M21, real& S12)
00123     const throw() {
00124     outmask &= OUT_ALL;
00125     lon1 = AngNormalize(lon1);
00126     real lon12 = AngNormalize(AngNormalize(lon2) - lon1);
00127     // If very close to being on the same meridian, then make it so.
00128     // Not sure this is necessary...
00129     lon12 = AngRound(lon12);
00130     // Make longitude difference positive.
00131     int lonsign = lon12 >= 0 ? 1 : -1;
00132     lon12 *= lonsign;
00133     if (lon12 == 180)
00134       lonsign = 1;
00135     // If really close to the equator, treat as on equator.
00136     lat1 = AngRound(lat1);
00137     lat2 = AngRound(lat2);
00138     // Swap points so that point with higher (abs) latitude is point 1
00139     int swapp = abs(lat1) >= abs(lat2) ? 1 : -1;
00140     if (swapp < 0) {
00141       lonsign *= -1;
00142       swap(lat1, lat2);
00143     }
00144     // Make lat1 <= 0
00145     int latsign = lat1 < 0 ? 1 : -1;
00146     lat1 *= latsign;
00147     lat2 *= latsign;
00148     // Now we have
00149     //
00150     //     0 <= lon12 <= 180
00151     //     -90 <= lat1 <= 0
00152     //     lat1 <= lat2 <= -lat1
00153     //
00154     // longsign, swapp, latsign register the transformation to bring the
00155     // coordinates to this canonical form.  In all cases, 1 means no change was
00156     // made.  We make these transformations so that there are few cases to
00157     // check, e.g., on verifying quadrants in atan2.  In addition, this
00158     // enforces some symmetries in the results returned.
00159 
00160     real phi, sbet1, cbet1, sbet2, cbet2, s12x, m12x;
00161 
00162     phi = lat1 * Constants::degree();
00163     // Ensure cbet1 = +epsilon at poles
00164     sbet1 = _f1 * sin(phi);
00165     cbet1 = lat1 == -90 ? eps2 : cos(phi);
00166     SinCosNorm(sbet1, cbet1);
00167 
00168     phi = lat2 * Constants::degree();
00169     // Ensure cbet2 = +epsilon at poles
00170     sbet2 = _f1 * sin(phi);
00171     cbet2 = abs(lat2) == 90 ? eps2 : cos(phi);
00172     SinCosNorm(sbet2, cbet2);
00173 
00174     real
00175       lam12 = lon12 * Constants::degree(),
00176       slam12 = lon12 == 180 ? 0 : sin(lam12),
00177       clam12 = cos(lam12);      // lon12 == 90 isn't interesting
00178 
00179     real sig12, calp1, salp1, calp2, salp2;
00180     // index zero elements of these arrays are unused
00181     real C1a[nC1 + 1], C2a[nC2 + 1], C3a[nC3];
00182 
00183     bool meridian = lat1 == -90 || slam12 == 0;
00184 
00185     if (meridian) {
00186 
00187       // Endpoints are on a single full meridian, so the geodesic might lie on
00188       // a meridian.
00189 
00190       calp1 = clam12; salp1 = slam12; // Head to the target longitude
00191       calp2 = 1; salp2 = 0;           // At the target we're heading north
00192 
00193       real
00194         // tan(bet) = tan(sig) * cos(alp),
00195         ssig1 = sbet1, csig1 = calp1 * cbet1,
00196         ssig2 = sbet2, csig2 = calp2 * cbet2;
00197 
00198       // sig12 = sig2 - sig1
00199       sig12 = atan2(max(csig1 * ssig2 - ssig1 * csig2, real(0)),
00200                     csig1 * csig2 + ssig1 * ssig2);
00201       {
00202         real dummy;
00203         Lengths(_n, sig12, ssig1, csig1, ssig2, csig2,
00204                 cbet1, cbet2, s12x, m12x, dummy,
00205                 (outmask & GEODESICSCALE) != 0U, M12, M21, C1a, C2a);
00206       }
00207       // Add the check for sig12 since zero length geodesics might yield m12 <
00208       // 0.  Test case was
00209       //
00210       //    echo 20.001 0 20.001 0 | Geod -i
00211       //
00212       // In fact, we will have sig12 > pi/2 for meridional geodesic which is
00213       // not a shortest path.
00214       if (sig12 < 1 || m12x >= 0) {
00215         m12x *= _a;
00216         s12x *= _b;
00217         sig12 /= Constants::degree();
00218       } else
00219         // m12 < 0, i.e., prolate and too close to anti-podal
00220         meridian = false;
00221     }
00222 
00223     if (!meridian &&
00224         sbet1 == 0 &&   // and sbet2 == 0
00225          // Mimic the way Lambda12 works with calp1 = 0
00226         (_f <= 0 || lam12 <= Constants::pi() - _f * Constants::pi())) {
00227 
00228       // Geodesic runs along equator
00229       calp1 = calp2 = 0; salp1 = salp2 = 1;
00230       s12x = _a * lam12;
00231       m12x = _b * sin(lam12 / _f1);
00232       if (outmask & GEODESICSCALE)
00233         M12 = M21 = cos(lam12 / _f1);
00234       sig12 = lon12 / _f1;
00235 
00236     } else if (!meridian) {
00237 
00238       // Now point1 and point2 belong within a hemisphere bounded by a
00239       // meridian and geodesic is neither meridional or equatorial.
00240 
00241       // Figure a starting point for Newton's method
00242       sig12 = InverseStart(sbet1, cbet1, sbet2, cbet2,
00243                            lam12,
00244                            salp1, calp1, salp2, calp2,
00245                            C1a, C2a);
00246 
00247       if (sig12 >= 0) {
00248         // Short lines (InverseStart sets salp2, calp2)
00249         real w1 = sqrt(1 - _e2 * sq(cbet1));
00250         s12x = sig12 * _a * w1;
00251         m12x = sq(w1) * _a / _f1 * sin(sig12 * _f1 / w1);
00252         if (outmask & GEODESICSCALE)
00253           M12 = M21 = cos(sig12 * _f1 / w1);
00254         sig12 /= Constants::degree();
00255       } else {
00256 
00257         // Newton's method
00258         real ssig1, csig1, ssig2, csig2, eps;
00259         real ov = 0;
00260         unsigned numit = 0;
00261         for (unsigned trip = 0; numit < maxit; ++numit) {
00262           real dv;
00263           real v = Lambda12(sbet1, cbet1, sbet2, cbet2, salp1, calp1,
00264                             salp2, calp2, sig12, ssig1, csig1, ssig2, csig2,
00265                             eps, trip < 1, dv, C1a, C2a, C3a) - lam12;
00266 
00267           if (abs(v) <= eps2 || !(trip < 1)) {
00268             if (abs(v) > max(tol1, ov))
00269               numit = maxit;
00270             break;
00271           }
00272           real
00273             dalp1 = -v/dv;
00274           real
00275             sdalp1 = sin(dalp1), cdalp1 = cos(dalp1),
00276             nsalp1 = salp1 * cdalp1 + calp1 * sdalp1;
00277           calp1 = calp1 * cdalp1 - salp1 * sdalp1;
00278           salp1 = max(real(0), nsalp1);
00279           SinCosNorm(salp1, calp1);
00280           // In some regimes we don't get quadratic convergence because slope
00281           // -> 0.  So use convergence conditions based on epsilon instead of
00282           // sqrt(epsilon).  The first criterion is a test on abs(v) against
00283           // 100 * epsilon.  The second takes credit for an anticipated
00284           // reduction in abs(v) by v/ov (due to the latest update in alp1) and
00285           // checks this against epsilon.
00286           if (abs(v) < tol1 || sq(v) < ov * tol0) ++trip;
00287           ov = abs(v);
00288         }
00289 
00290         if (numit >= maxit) {
00291           // Signal failure.
00292           if (outmask & DISTANCE)
00293             s12 = Math::NaN();
00294           if (outmask & AZIMUTH)
00295             azi1 = azi2 = Math::NaN();
00296           if (outmask & REDUCEDLENGTH)
00297             m12 = Math::NaN();
00298           if (outmask & GEODESICSCALE)
00299             M12 = M21 = Math::NaN();
00300           if (outmask & AREA)
00301             S12 = Math::NaN();
00302           return Math::NaN();
00303         }
00304 
00305         {
00306           real dummy;
00307           Lengths(eps, sig12, ssig1, csig1, ssig2, csig2,
00308                   cbet1, cbet2, s12x, m12x, dummy,
00309                   (outmask & GEODESICSCALE) != 0U, M12, M21, C1a, C2a);
00310         }
00311         m12x *= _a;
00312         s12x *= _b;
00313         sig12 /= Constants::degree();
00314       }
00315     }
00316 
00317     if (outmask & DISTANCE)
00318       s12 = s12x;
00319 
00320     if (outmask & REDUCEDLENGTH)
00321       m12 = m12x;
00322 
00323     if (outmask & AREA) {
00324       real
00325         // From Lambda12: sin(alp1) * cos(bet1) = sin(alp0)
00326         salp0 = salp1 * cbet1,
00327         calp0 = Math::hypot(calp1, salp1 * sbet1), // calp0 > 0
00328         // Multiplier = a^2 * e^2 * cos(alpha0) * sin(alpha0)
00329         A4 = sq(_a) * calp0 * salp0 * _e2;
00330       if (A4 == 0)
00331         // Avoid problems with indeterminate sig1, sig2 on equator
00332         S12 = 0;
00333       else {
00334         real
00335           // From Lambda12: tan(bet) = tan(sig) * cos(alp)
00336           ssig1 = sbet1, csig1 = calp1 * cbet1,
00337           ssig2 = sbet2, csig2 = calp2 * cbet2,
00338           k2 = sq(calp0) * _ep2;
00339         SinCosNorm(ssig1, csig1);
00340         SinCosNorm(ssig2, csig2);
00341         real C4a[nC4];
00342         C4f(k2, C4a);
00343         real
00344           B41 = Geodesic::SinCosSeries(false, ssig1, csig1, C4a, nC4),
00345           B42 = Geodesic::SinCosSeries(false, ssig2, csig2, C4a, nC4);
00346         S12 = A4 * (B42 - B41);
00347       }
00348       real
00349         // alp12 = alp2 - alp1, used in atan2 so no need to normalized
00350         salp12 = salp2 * calp1 - calp2 * salp1,
00351         calp12 = calp2 * calp1 + salp2 * salp1;
00352       // The right thing appears to happen if alp1 = +/-180 and alp2 = 0, viz
00353       // salp12 = -0 and alp12 = -180.  However this depends on the sign being
00354       // attached to 0 correctly.  The following ensures the correct behavior.
00355       if (salp12 == 0 && calp12 < 0) {
00356         salp12 = Geodesic::eps2 * calp1;
00357         calp12 = -1;
00358       }
00359       S12 += _c2 * atan2(salp12, calp12);
00360       S12 *= swapp * lonsign * latsign;
00361       // Convert -0 to 0
00362       S12 += 0;
00363     }
00364 
00365     // Convert calp, salp to azimuth accounting for lonsign, swapp, latsign.
00366     if (swapp < 0) {
00367       swap(salp1, salp2);
00368       swap(calp1, calp2);
00369       if (outmask & GEODESICSCALE)
00370         swap(M12, M21);
00371     }
00372 
00373     salp1 *= swapp * lonsign; calp1 *= swapp * latsign;
00374     salp2 *= swapp * lonsign; calp2 *= swapp * latsign;
00375 
00376     if (outmask & AZIMUTH) {
00377       // minus signs give range [-180, 180). 0- converts -0 to +0.
00378       azi1 = 0 - atan2(-salp1, calp1) / Constants::degree();
00379       azi2 = 0 - atan2(-salp2, calp2) / Constants::degree();
00380     }
00381 
00382     // Returned value in [0, 180]
00383     return sig12;
00384   }
00385 
00386   void Geodesic::Lengths(real eps, real sig12,
00387                          real ssig1, real csig1, real ssig2, real csig2,
00388                          real cbet1, real cbet2,
00389                          real& s12b, real& m12a, real& m0,
00390                          bool scalep, real& M12, real& M21,
00391                          // Scratch areas of the right size
00392                          real C1a[], real C2a[]) const throw() {
00393     // Return m12a = (reduced length)/_a; also calculate s12b = distance/_b,
00394     // and m0 = coefficient of secular term in expression for reduced length.
00395     C1f(eps, C1a);
00396     C2f(eps, C2a);
00397     real
00398       A1m1 = A1m1f(eps),
00399       AB1 = (1 + A1m1) * (SinCosSeries(true, ssig2, csig2, C1a, nC1) -
00400                           SinCosSeries(true, ssig1, csig1, C1a, nC1)),
00401       A2m1 = A2m1f(eps),
00402       AB2 = (1 + A2m1) * (SinCosSeries(true, ssig2, csig2, C2a, nC2) -
00403                           SinCosSeries(true, ssig1, csig1, C2a, nC2)),
00404       cbet1sq = sq(cbet1),
00405       cbet2sq = sq(cbet2),
00406       w1 = sqrt(1 - _e2 * cbet1sq),
00407       w2 = sqrt(1 - _e2 * cbet2sq),
00408       // Make sure it's OK to have repeated dummy arguments
00409       m0x = A1m1 - A2m1,
00410       J12 = m0x * sig12 + (AB1 - AB2);
00411     m0 = m0x;
00412     // Missing a factor of _a.
00413     // Add parens around (csig1 * ssig2) and (ssig1 * csig2) to ensure accurate
00414     // cancellation in the case of coincident points.
00415     m12a = (w2 * (csig1 * ssig2) - w1 * (ssig1 * csig2))
00416       - _f1 * csig1 * csig2 * J12;
00417     // Missing a factor of _b
00418     s12b =  (1 + A1m1) * sig12 + AB1;
00419     if (scalep) {
00420       real csig12 = csig1 * csig2 + ssig1 * ssig2;
00421       J12 *= _f1;
00422       M12 = csig12 + (_e2 * (cbet1sq - cbet2sq) * ssig2 / (w1 + w2)
00423                       - csig2 * J12) * ssig1 / w1;
00424       M21 = csig12 - (_e2 * (cbet1sq - cbet2sq) * ssig1 / (w1 + w2)
00425                       - csig1 * J12) * ssig2 / w2;
00426     }
00427   }
00428 
00429   Math::real Geodesic::Astroid(real x, real y) throw() {
00430     // Solve k^4+2*k^3-(x^2+y^2-1)*k^2-2*y^2*k-y^2 = 0 for positive root k.
00431     // This solution is adapted from Geocentric::Reverse.
00432     real k;
00433     real
00434       p = sq(x),
00435       q = sq(y),
00436       r = (p + q - 1) / 6;
00437     if ( !(q == 0 && r <= 0) ) {
00438       real
00439         // Avoid possible division by zero when r = 0 by multiplying equations
00440         // for s and t by r^3 and r, resp.
00441         S = p * q / 4,            // S = r^3 * s
00442         r2 = sq(r),
00443         r3 = r * r2,
00444         // The discrimant of the quadratic equation for T3.  This is zero on
00445         // the evolute curve p^(1/3)+q^(1/3) = 1
00446         disc =  S * (S + 2 * r3);
00447       real u = r;
00448       if (disc >= 0) {
00449         real T3 = S + r3;
00450         // Pick the sign on the sqrt to maximize abs(T3).  This minimizes loss
00451         // of precision due to cancellation.  The result is unchanged because
00452         // of the way the T is used in definition of u.
00453         T3 += T3 < 0 ? -sqrt(disc) : sqrt(disc); // T3 = (r * t)^3
00454         // N.B. cbrt always returns the real root.  cbrt(-8) = -2.
00455         real T = Math::cbrt(T3); // T = r * t
00456         // T can be zero; but then r2 / T -> 0.
00457         u += T + (T != 0 ? r2 / T : 0);
00458       } else {
00459         // T is complex, but the way u is defined the result is real.
00460         real ang = atan2(sqrt(-disc), -(S + r3));
00461         // There are three possible cube roots.  We choose the root which
00462         // avoids cancellation.  Note that disc < 0 implies that r < 0.
00463         u += 2 * r * cos(ang / 3);
00464       }
00465       real
00466         v = sqrt(sq(u) + q),    // guaranteed positive
00467         // Avoid loss of accuracy when u < 0.
00468         uv = u < 0 ? q / (v - u) : u + v, // u+v, guaranteed positive
00469         w = (uv - q) / (2 * v);           // positive?
00470       // Rearrange expression for k to avoid loss of accuracy due to
00471       // subtraction.  Division by 0 not possible because uv > 0, w >= 0.
00472       k = uv / (sqrt(uv + sq(w)) + w);   // guaranteed positive
00473     } else {               // q == 0 && r <= 0
00474       // y = 0 with |x| <= 1.  Handle this case directly.
00475       // for y small, positive root is k = abs(y)/sqrt(1-x^2)
00476       k = 0;
00477     }
00478     return k;
00479   }
00480 
00481   Math::real Geodesic::InverseStart(real sbet1, real cbet1,
00482                                     real sbet2, real cbet2,
00483                                     real lam12,
00484                                     real& salp1, real& calp1,
00485                                     // Only updated if return val >= 0
00486                                     real& salp2, real& calp2,
00487                                     // Scratch areas of the right size
00488                                     real C1a[], real C2a[]) const throw() {
00489     // Return a starting point for Newton's method in salp1 and calp1 (function
00490     // value is -1).  If Newton's method doesn't need to be used, return also
00491     // salp2 and calp2 and function value is sig12.
00492     real
00493       sig12 = -1,               // Return value
00494       // bet12 = bet2 - bet1 in [0, pi); bet12a = bet2 + bet1 in (-pi, 0]
00495       sbet12 = sbet2 * cbet1 - cbet2 * sbet1,
00496       cbet12 = cbet2 * cbet1 + sbet2 * sbet1,
00497       sbet12a = sbet2 * cbet1 + cbet2 * sbet1;
00498 
00499     bool shortline = cbet12 >= 0 && sbet12 < real(0.5) &&
00500       lam12 <= Constants::pi() / 6;
00501     real
00502       omg12 = shortline ? lam12 / sqrt(1 - _e2 * sq(cbet1)) : lam12,
00503       somg12 = sin(omg12), comg12 = cos(omg12);
00504 
00505     salp1 = cbet2 * somg12;
00506     calp1 = comg12 >= 0 ?
00507       sbet12 + cbet2 * sbet1 * sq(somg12) / (1 + comg12) :
00508       sbet12a - cbet2 * sbet1 * sq(somg12) / (1 - comg12);
00509 
00510     real
00511       ssig12 = Math::hypot(salp1, calp1),
00512       csig12 = sbet1 * sbet2 + cbet1 * cbet2 * comg12;
00513 
00514     if (shortline && ssig12 < _etol2) {
00515       // really short lines
00516       salp2 = cbet1 * somg12;
00517       calp2 = sbet12 - cbet1 * sbet2 * sq(somg12) / (1 + comg12);
00518       SinCosNorm(salp2, calp2);
00519       // Set return value
00520       sig12 = atan2(ssig12, csig12);
00521     } else if (csig12 >= 0 ||
00522                ssig12 >= 3 * abs(_f) * Constants::pi() * sq(cbet1)) {
00523       // Nothing to do, zeroth order spherical approximation is OK
00524 
00525     } else {
00526       // Scale lam12 and bet2 to x, y coordinate system where antipodal point
00527       // is at origin and singular point is at y = 0, x = -1.
00528       real x, y, lamscale, betscale;
00529       if (_f >= 0) {            // In fact f == 0 does not get here
00530         // x = dlong, y = dlat
00531         {
00532           real
00533             k2 = sq(sbet1) * _ep2,
00534             eps = k2 / (2 * (1 + sqrt(1 + k2)) + k2);
00535           lamscale = _f * cbet1 * A3f(eps) * Constants::pi();
00536         }
00537         betscale = lamscale * cbet1;
00538 
00539         x = (lam12 - Constants::pi()) / lamscale;
00540         y = sbet12a / betscale;
00541       } else {                  // _f < 0
00542         // x = dlat, y = dlong
00543         real
00544           cbet12a = cbet2 * cbet1 - sbet2 * sbet1,
00545           bet12a = atan2(sbet12a, cbet12a);
00546         real m0, dummy;
00547         // In the case of lon12 = 180, this repeats a calculation made in
00548         // Inverse.
00549         Lengths(_n, Constants::pi() + bet12a, sbet1, -cbet1, sbet2, cbet2,
00550                 cbet1, cbet2, dummy, x, m0, false, dummy, dummy, C1a, C2a);
00551         x = -1 + x/(_f1 * cbet1 * cbet2 * m0 * Constants::pi());
00552         betscale = x < -real(0.01) ? sbet12a / x :
00553           -_f * sq(cbet1) * Constants::pi();
00554         lamscale = betscale / cbet1;
00555         y = (lam12 - Constants::pi()) / lamscale;
00556       }
00557 
00558       if (y > -tol1 && x >  -1 - xthresh) {
00559         // strip near cut
00560         if (_f >= 0) {
00561           salp1 = min(real( 1), -x); calp1 = - sqrt(1 - sq(salp1));
00562         } else {
00563           calp1 = max(real(x > -tol1 ? 0 : -1),  x);
00564           salp1 = sqrt(1 - sq(calp1));
00565         }
00566       } else {
00567         // Estimate omega12, by solving the astroid problem.
00568         real k = Astroid(x, y);
00569         // estimate omg12a = pi - omg12
00570         real
00571           omg12a = lamscale * ( _f >= 0 ? -x * k/(1 + k) : -y * (1 + k)/k ),
00572           somg12 = sin(omg12a), comg12 = -cos(omg12a);
00573         // Update spherical estimate of alp1 using omg12 instead of lam12
00574         salp1 = cbet2 * somg12;
00575         calp1 = sbet12a - cbet2 * sbet1 * sq(somg12) / (1 - comg12);
00576       }
00577     }
00578     SinCosNorm(salp1, calp1);
00579     return sig12;
00580   }
00581 
00582   Math::real Geodesic::Lambda12(real sbet1, real cbet1, real sbet2, real cbet2,
00583                                 real salp1, real calp1,
00584                                 real& salp2, real& calp2,
00585                                 real& sig12,
00586                                 real& ssig1, real& csig1,
00587                                 real& ssig2, real& csig2,
00588                                 real& eps, bool diffp, real& dlam12,
00589                                 // Scratch areas of the right size
00590                                 real C1a[], real C2a[], real C3a[]) const
00591     throw() {
00592 
00593     if (sbet1 == 0 && calp1 == 0)
00594       // Break degeneracy of equatorial line.  This case has already been
00595       // handled.
00596       calp1 = -eps2;
00597 
00598     real
00599       // sin(alp1) * cos(bet1) = sin(alp0),
00600       salp0 = salp1 * cbet1,
00601       calp0 = Math::hypot(calp1, salp1 * sbet1); // calp0 > 0
00602 
00603     real somg1, comg1, somg2, comg2, omg12, lam12;
00604     // tan(bet1) = tan(sig1) * cos(alp1)
00605     // tan(omg1) = sin(alp0) * tan(sig1) = tan(omg1)=tan(alp1)*sin(bet1)
00606     ssig1 = sbet1; somg1 = salp0 * sbet1;
00607     csig1 = comg1 = calp1 * cbet1;
00608     SinCosNorm(ssig1, csig1);
00609     SinCosNorm(somg1, comg1);
00610 
00611     // Enforce symmetries in the case abs(bet2) = -bet1.  Need to be careful
00612     // about this case, since this can yield singularities in the Newton
00613     // iteration.
00614     // sin(alp2) * cos(bet2) = sin(alp0),
00615     salp2 = cbet2 != cbet1 ? salp0 / cbet2 : salp1;
00616     // calp2 = sqrt(1 - sq(salp2))
00617     //       = sqrt(sq(calp0) - sq(sbet2)) / cbet2
00618     // and subst for calp0 and rearrange to give (choose positive sqrt
00619     // to give alp2 in [0, pi/2]).
00620     calp2 = cbet2 != cbet1 || abs(sbet2) != -sbet1 ?
00621       sqrt(sq(calp1 * cbet1) + (cbet1 < -sbet1 ?
00622                                 (cbet2 - cbet1) * (cbet1 + cbet2) :
00623                                 (sbet1 - sbet2) * (sbet1 + sbet2))) / cbet2 :
00624       abs(calp1);
00625     // tan(bet2) = tan(sig2) * cos(alp2)
00626     // tan(omg2) = sin(alp0) * tan(sig2).
00627     ssig2 = sbet2; somg2 = salp0 * sbet2;
00628     csig2 = comg2 = calp2 * cbet2;
00629     SinCosNorm(ssig2, csig2);
00630     SinCosNorm(somg2, comg2);
00631 
00632     // sig12 = sig2 - sig1, limit to [0, pi]
00633     sig12 = atan2(max(csig1 * ssig2 - ssig1 * csig2, real(0)),
00634                   csig1 * csig2 + ssig1 * ssig2);
00635 
00636     // omg12 = omg2 - omg1, limit to [0, pi]
00637     omg12 = atan2(max(comg1 * somg2 - somg1 * comg2, real(0)),
00638                   comg1 * comg2 + somg1 * somg2);
00639     real B312, h0;
00640     real k2 = sq(calp0) * _ep2;
00641     eps = k2 / (2 * (1 + sqrt(1 + k2)) + k2);
00642     C3f(eps, C3a);
00643     B312 = (SinCosSeries(true, ssig2, csig2, C3a, nC3-1) -
00644             SinCosSeries(true, ssig1, csig1, C3a, nC3-1));
00645     h0 = -_f * A3f(eps),
00646     lam12 = omg12 + salp0 * h0 * (sig12 + B312);
00647 
00648     if (diffp) {
00649       if (calp2 == 0)
00650         dlam12 = - 2 * sqrt(1 - _e2 * sq(cbet1)) / sbet1;
00651       else {
00652         real dummy;
00653         Lengths(eps, sig12, ssig1, csig1, ssig2, csig2,
00654                 cbet1, cbet2, dummy, dlam12, dummy,
00655                 false, dummy, dummy,  C1a, C2a);
00656         dlam12 /= calp2 * cbet2;
00657       }
00658     }
00659 
00660     return lam12;
00661   }
00662 
00663   Math::real Geodesic::A3f(real eps) const throw() {
00664     // Evaluation sum(_A3c[k] * eps^k, k, 0, nA3x-1) by Horner's method
00665     real v = 0;
00666     for (int i = nA3x; i; )
00667       v = eps * v + _A3x[--i];
00668     return v;
00669   }
00670 
00671   void Geodesic::C3f(real eps, real c[]) const throw() {
00672     // Evaluation C3 coeffs by Horner's method
00673     // Elements c[1] thru c[nC3 - 1] are set
00674     for (int j = nC3x, k = nC3 - 1; k; ) {
00675       real t = 0;
00676       for (int i = nC3 - k; i; --i)
00677         t = eps * t + _C3x[--j];
00678       c[k--] = t;
00679     }
00680 
00681     real mult = 1;
00682     for (int k = 1; k < nC3; ) {
00683       mult *= eps;
00684       c[k++] *= mult;
00685     }
00686   }
00687 
00688   void Geodesic::C4f(real k2, real c[]) const throw() {
00689     // Evaluation C4 coeffs by Horner's method
00690     // Elements c[0] thru c[nC4 - 1] are set
00691     for (int j = nC4x, k = nC4; k; ) {
00692       real t = 0;
00693       for (int i = nC4 - k + 1; i; --i)
00694         t = k2 * t + _C4x[--j];
00695       c[--k] = t;
00696     }
00697 
00698     real mult = 1;
00699     for (int k = 1; k < nC4; ) {
00700       mult *= k2;
00701       c[k++] *= mult;
00702     }
00703   }

00707   // The scale factor A1-1 = mean value of I1-1
00708   Math::real Geodesic::A1m1f(real eps) throw() {
00709     real
00710       eps2 = sq(eps),
00711       t;
00712     switch (nA1/2) {
00713     case 0:
00714       t = 0;
00715       break;
00716     case 1:
00717       t = eps2/4;
00718       break;
00719     case 2:
00720       t = eps2*(eps2+16)/64;
00721       break;
00722     case 3:
00723       t = eps2*(eps2*(eps2+4)+64)/256;
00724       break;
00725     case 4:
00726       t = eps2*(eps2*(eps2*(25*eps2+64)+256)+4096)/16384;
00727       break;
00728     default:
00729       STATIC_ASSERT(nA1 >= 0 && nA1 <= 8, "Bad value of nA1");
00730       t = 0;
00731     }
00732     return (t + eps) / (1 - eps);
00733   }

00921   // The scale factor A2-1 = mean value of I2-1
00922   Math::real Geodesic::A2m1f(real eps) throw() {
00923     real
00924       eps2 = sq(eps),
00925       t;
00926     switch (nA2/2) {
00927     case 0:
00928       t = 0;
00929       break;
00930     case 1:
00931       t = eps2/4;
00932       break;
00933     case 2:
00934       t = eps2*(9*eps2+16)/64;
00935       break;
00936     case 3:
00937       t = eps2*(eps2*(25*eps2+36)+64)/256;
00938       break;
00939     case 4:
00940       t = eps2*(eps2*(eps2*(1225*eps2+1600)+2304)+4096)/16384;
00941       break;
00942     default:
00943       STATIC_ASSERT(nA2 >= 0 && nA2 <= 8, "Bad value of nA2");
00944       t = 0;
00945     }
00946     return t * (1 - eps) - eps;
00947   }

00949   // The coefficients C2[l] in the Fourier expansion of B2
00950   void Geodesic::C2f(real eps, real c[]) throw() {

01027       c[4] = d*(eps2*(133*eps2+224)+1120)/16384;
01028       d *= eps;
01029       c[5] = d*(105*eps2+504)/10240;
01030       d *= eps;
01031       c[6] = d*(33*eps2+154)/4096;
01032       d *= eps;
01033       c[7] = 429*d/14336;
01034       d *= eps;
01035       c[8] = 6435*d/262144;
01036       break;
01037     default:
01038       STATIC_ASSERT(nC2 >= 0 && nC2 <= 8, "Bad value of nC2");
01039     }
01040   }

01042   // The scale factor A3 = mean value of I3
01043   void Geodesic::A3coeff() throw() {
01044     switch (nA3) {
01045     case 0:
01046       break;
01047     case 1:
01048       _A3x[0] = 1;
01049       break;
01050     case 2:
01051       _A3x[0] = 1;
01052       _A3x[1] = -1/real(2);
01053       break;
01054     case 3:
01055       _A3x[0] = 1;
01056       _A3x[1] = (_n-1)/2;
01057       _A3x[2] = -1/real(4);
01058       break;
01059     case 4:
01060       _A3x[0] = 1;
01061       _A3x[1] = (_n-1)/2;
01062       _A3x[2] = (-_n-2)/8;
01063       _A3x[3] = -1/real(16);
01064       break;
01065     case 5:
01066       _A3x[0] = 1;
01067       _A3x[1] = (_n-1)/2;
01068       _A3x[2] = (_n*(3*_n-1)-2)/8;
01069       _A3x[3] = (-3*_n-1)/16;
01070       _A3x[4] = -3/real(64);
01071       break;
01072     case 6:
01073       _A3x[0] = 1;
01074       _A3x[1] = (_n-1)/2;
01075       _A3x[2] = (_n*(3*_n-1)-2)/8;
01076       _A3x[3] = ((-_n-3)*_n-1)/16;
01077       _A3x[4] = (-2*_n-3)/64;
01078       _A3x[5] = -3/real(128);
01079       break;
01080     case 7:
01081       _A3x[0] = 1;
01082       _A3x[1] = (_n-1)/2;
01083       _A3x[2] = (_n*(3*_n-1)-2)/8;
01084       _A3x[3] = (_n*(_n*(5*_n-1)-3)-1)/16;
01085       _A3x[4] = ((-10*_n-2)*_n-3)/64;
01086       _A3x[5] = (-5*_n-3)/128;
01087       _A3x[6] = -5/real(256);
01088       break;
01089     case 8:
01090       _A3x[0] = 1;
01091       _A3x[1] = (_n-1)/2;
01092       _A3x[2] = (_n*(3*_n-1)-2)/8;
01093       _A3x[3] = (_n*(_n*(5*_n-1)-3)-1)/16;
01094       _A3x[4] = (_n*((-5*_n-20)*_n-4)-6)/128;
01095       _A3x[5] = ((-5*_n-10)*_n-6)/256;
01096       _A3x[6] = (-15*_n-20)/1024;
01097       _A3x[7] = -25/real(2048);
01098       break;
01099     default:
01100       STATIC_ASSERT(nA3 >= 0 && nA3 <= 8, "Bad value of nA3");
01101     }
01102   }

01104   // The coefficients C3[l] in the Fourier expansion of B3
01105   void Geodesic::C3coeff() throw() {
01106     switch (nC3) {
01107     case 0:
01108       break;
01109     case 1:
01110       break;
01111     case 2:
01112       _C3x[0] = 1/real(4);
01113       break;
01114     case 3:
01115       _C3x[0] = (1-_n)/4;
01116       _C3x[1] = 1/real(8);
01117       _C3x[2] = 1/real(16);
01118       break;
01119     case 4:
01120       _C3x[0] = (1-_n)/4;
01121       _C3x[1] = 1/real(8);
01122       _C3x[2] = 3/real(64);
01123       _C3x[3] = (2-3*_n)/32;
01124       _C3x[4] = 3/real(64);
01125       _C3x[5] = 5/real(192);
01126       break;
01127     case 5:
01128       _C3x[0] = (1-_n)/4;
01129       _C3x[1] = (1-_n*_n)/8;
01130       _C3x[2] = (3*_n+3)/64;
01131       _C3x[3] = 5/real(128);
01132       _C3x[4] = ((_n-3)*_n+2)/32;
01133       _C3x[5] = (3-2*_n)/64;
01134       _C3x[6] = 3/real(128);
01135       _C3x[7] = (5-9*_n)/192;
01136       _C3x[8] = 3/real(128);
01137       _C3x[9] = 7/real(512);
01138       break;
01139     case 6:
01140       _C3x[0] = (1-_n)/4;
01141       _C3x[1] = (1-_n*_n)/8;
01142       _C3x[2] = ((3-_n)*_n+3)/64;
01143       _C3x[3] = (2*_n+5)/128;
01144       _C3x[4] = 3/real(128);
01145       _C3x[5] = ((_n-3)*_n+2)/32;
01146       _C3x[6] = ((-3*_n-2)*_n+3)/64;
01147       _C3x[7] = (_n+3)/128;
01148       _C3x[8] = 5/real(256);
01149       _C3x[9] = (_n*(5*_n-9)+5)/192;
01150       _C3x[10] = (9-10*_n)/384;
01151       _C3x[11] = 7/real(512);
01152       _C3x[12] = (7-14*_n)/512;
01153       _C3x[13] = 7/real(512);
01154       _C3x[14] = 21/real(2560);
01155       break;
01156     case 7:
01157       _C3x[0] = (1-_n)/4;
01158       _C3x[1] = (1-_n*_n)/8;
01159       _C3x[2] = (_n*((-5*_n-1)*_n+3)+3)/64;
01160       _C3x[3] = (_n*(2*_n+2)+5)/128;
01161       _C3x[4] = (11*_n+12)/512;
01162       _C3x[5] = 21/real(1024);
01163       _C3x[6] = ((_n-3)*_n+2)/32;
01164       _C3x[7] = (_n*(_n*(2*_n-3)-2)+3)/64;
01165       _C3x[8] = ((2-9*_n)*_n+6)/256;
01166       _C3x[9] = (_n+5)/256;
01167       _C3x[10] = 27/real(2048);
01168       _C3x[11] = (_n*((5-_n)*_n-9)+5)/192;
01169       _C3x[12] = ((-6*_n-10)*_n+9)/384;
01170       _C3x[13] = (21-4*_n)/1536;
01171       _C3x[14] = 3/real(256);
01172       _C3x[15] = (_n*(10*_n-14)+7)/512;
01173       _C3x[16] = (7-10*_n)/512;
01174       _C3x[17] = 9/real(1024);
01175       _C3x[18] = (21-45*_n)/2560;
01176       _C3x[19] = 9/real(1024);
01177       _C3x[20] = 11/real(2048);
01178       break;
01179     case 8:
01180       _C3x[0] = (1-_n)/4;
01181       _C3x[1] = (1-_n*_n)/8;
01182       _C3x[2] = (_n*((-5*_n-1)*_n+3)+3)/64;
01183       _C3x[3] = (_n*((2-2*_n)*_n+2)+5)/128;
01184       _C3x[4] = (_n*(3*_n+11)+12)/512;
01185       _C3x[5] = (10*_n+21)/1024;
01186       _C3x[6] = 243/real(16384);
01187       _C3x[7] = ((_n-3)*_n+2)/32;
01188       _C3x[8] = (_n*(_n*(2*_n-3)-2)+3)/64;
01189       _C3x[9] = (_n*((-6*_n-9)*_n+2)+6)/256;
01190       _C3x[10] = ((1-2*_n)*_n+5)/256;
01191       _C3x[11] = (69*_n+108)/8192;
01192       _C3x[12] = 187/real(16384);
01193       _C3x[13] = (_n*((5-_n)*_n-9)+5)/192;
01194       _C3x[14] = (_n*(_n*(10*_n-6)-10)+9)/384;
01195       _C3x[15] = ((-77*_n-8)*_n+42)/3072;
01196       _C3x[16] = (12-_n)/1024;
01197       _C3x[17] = 139/real(16384);
01198       _C3x[18] = (_n*((20-7*_n)*_n-28)+14)/1024;
01199       _C3x[19] = ((-7*_n-40)*_n+28)/2048;
01200       _C3x[20] = (72-43*_n)/8192;
01201       _C3x[21] = 127/real(16384);
01202       _C3x[22] = (_n*(75*_n-90)+42)/5120;
01203       _C3x[23] = (9-15*_n)/1024;
01204       _C3x[24] = 99/real(16384);
01205       _C3x[25] = (44-99*_n)/8192;
01206       _C3x[26] = 99/real(16384);
01207       _C3x[27] = 429/real(114688);
01208       break;
01209     default:
01210       STATIC_ASSERT(nC3 >= 0 && nC3 <= 8, "Bad value of nC3");
01211     }
